ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Readings and scope of topics covered
The opportunity to discuss such an interdisciplinary issue with students from many different backgrounds. The readings provided a solid foundation to build on through discussion.
The mix of students from different schools and backgrounds improved the quality of discussion, and made us discuss many different aspects of food security.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Discussion section moderationBetter teaching of conceptsDeeper analysis

It would have been helpful to work in teams of two on the first assignment, as data collection from the FAOSTAT website took a long time and students had different levels of experience in analyzing economic data. I would have also liked to see student-led discussions to help encourage more fully developed conversations.

I sometimes left the class with the exact same questions I had coming into the discussion. It might be nice to incorporate the discussion questions in the reading responses into the discussion more - maybe having the instructor bring up the most commonly asked questions for discussion and providing insight on them?

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course provided an international perspective on the food systems issues that I have not found in my other courses.
Fantastic course and at this point, necessary for anyone working in forestry or development since it's so trendy. I'm glad I got a chance to take the course.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See Question 17. Also, the instructor is wonderful.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: I was satisfied that this course provided a solid foundation for further studies on food security, but I had hoped for more in depth discussion and resources for further work.

I wish I had more answers or more concrete information to take away, instead of a good idea of the main questions in the field. I'd love to have done an exercise in designing a study to measure malnutrition, etc to get an applied skill from the class and to talk more concretely about metrics.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I would recommendthis course for any student who is looking for a broad survey of of food security issues.
